SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Class DatagramConnector

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.DatagramConnector
Direct Known Subclasses:
DatagramClient, DatagramServer
public abstract class DatagramConnector extends Object
Abstract base class for datagram (UDP) connection factories. Provides DTLS context management similar to how Connector manages TLS for TCP connections.

Subclasses include:

  • DatagramServer - for receiving datagrams on a bound port
  • DatagramClient - for sending datagrams to a remote address
Author:
Chris Burdess

      public TelemetryConfig getTelemetryConfig()

      Returns:
      the telemetry configuration, or null if not configured

      Parameters:

    • isTelemetryEnabled

      public boolean isTelemetryEnabled()
      Returns true if telemetry is enabled for this connector. Telemetry is enabled when a TelemetryConfig has been set.
      Returns:
      true if telemetry is enabled

    • isSecure

      public boolean isSecure()
      Indicates whether this connector uses DTLS for encryption.
      Returns:
      true if DTLS is enabled

    • setSecure

      public void setSecure(boolean flag)
      Sets whether this connector should use DTLS for encryption. If true, you should also specify a key store for the certificate.
      Parameters:
      flag - whether this connector should be secure

    • setKeystoreFile

      public void setKeystoreFile(String file)

    • createDTLSEngine

      protected SSLEngine createDTLSEngine(InetSocketAddress remoteAddress)
      Creates a DTLS engine for the given remote address. DTLS engines are created per-remote-address for session management.
      Parameters:
      remoteAddress - the remote address for the DTLS session
      Returns:
      the configured SSLEngine, or null if DTLS is not enabled

    • configureDTLSEngine

      protected void configureDTLSEngine(SSLEngine engine)
      Configures DTLS engine settings. Default implementation sets useClientMode to false (server mode). Subclasses can override to add additional DTLS configuration.
      Parameters:
      engine - the DTLS engine to configure

    • start

      protected void start()
      Starts this connector. Initializes DTLS context if SSL configuration is provided.

    • stop

      protected void stop()
      Stops this connector.

    • getDescription

      protected abstract String getDescription()
      Returns a short (one word) description of this connector.
      Returns:
      the description
